intro: Fleurya cuneata var. grossa, commonly known as the broadleaf fleurya, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Asia. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its elliptical, leathery leaves and clusters of small, white to pinkish flowers. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in forests or along stream banks. The fruit is a small, three-lobed capsule that contains several seeds.
